items.title: Live: Emergency warnings for fires in Victoria as heatwave sweeps across southern Australia
items.description: Large areas of Australia, from Western Australia's north-west to Tasmania's north-east, have been issued with severe to extreme heatwave warnings from Wednesday to Saturday. Follow our live blog.

items.title: 'It feels wrong': Final Bondi terror attack funeral held in Sydney
items.description: A retired detective has been remembered as an "incredibly moral and honest man" at a funeral service three weeks after he was killed in the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: The US may have Nicolás Maduro but 'the prince' remains in Caracas
items.description: Nicolás Maduro Guerra rose through the ranks of his father's government and remains in Caracas. It's uncertain for how long.

items.title: Why does Trump want Greenland and why is it so important?
items.description: Donald Trump's continued interest in Greenland is part of his "America First" agenda to dominate the Western Hemisphere and contain China's interests in the region.

items.title: 'Very pleasant surprise': inflation cools but remains above RBA target
items.description: Inflation cooled in November, with the consumer price index rising 3.4 per cent over the year, down from 3.8 per cent a month earlier. Some economists continue to forecast a February rate hike, however.

items.title: How an encounter with an AI hallucination raised an ethical dilemma
items.description: When a journalist emails a company with questions looking for answers, the least they expect is a real person to feed them the spin, half-truths or outright lies. Not a machine.

items.title: Aboriginal artist Bobbi Lockyer in tears as Australia Post loses $4k painting
items.description: Indigenous artist Bobbi Lockyer has been left frustrated after she sent a $4,000 custom artwork of the Pilbara to a buyer in Queensland, only for an empty cardboard sleeve to be delivered.

items.title: Ex-CIA agent convicted of spying for Soviets dies in prison
items.description: Aldrich Ames, who was 84, betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging intelligence breaches in US history.

items.title: Live: Webster lights up SCG as England young gun arrives on Test scene
items.description: England ends day four with a 119-run lead after a sparkling century to 22-year-old Jacob Bethell. Follow live.

items.title: Men charged over alleged international theft syndicate targeting Toyota 4WDs
items.description: Queensland Police say 60 Toyota LandCruisers and Prados were stolen across Brisbane between October 20 and December 1.

items.title: Nurse banned for two years after unlawfully injecting patient with botox
items.description: An AHPRA investigation found Thia Sullivan injected a patient without doctor consultation or a script, falsified records, and urged patients not to co-operate with police.

items.title: The bizarre tale of Angie Fuller's disappearance still baffles police three years on
items.description: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

items.title: Israel cleared to start West Bank settlement construction
items.description: Critics say the E1 project would prevent the establishment of a contiguous Palestinian state.

items.title: Bayer's Monsanto sues COVID vaccine makers for alleged mRNA infringement
items.description: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

items.title: Kidman and Urban divorce after two decades as red carpet power couple
items.description: After 19 years as one of the entertainment world's most recognisable couples, actor Nicole Kidman and musician Keith Urban are officially divorced.

items.title: Staff at new Adelaide mental health unit 'visibly distressed and crying', union says
items.description: South Australia's doctors' union has raised concerns that clinicians were distressed when asked to admit more patients at a new mental health unit at Noarlunga Hospital when staffing levels were "not clinically safe".

items.title: These songs from the Hottest 100 of 2005 deserved better
items.description: Arctic Monkeys were that low!? These are the tunes from triple j's Hottest 100 of 20. years ago that deserved to have placed higher.

items.title: Diggers remove 50 tonnes of seaweed from Sydney beach as masses wash up
items.description: Piles of kelp were removed from a popular Sydney beach, although some councils prefer to leave the seaweed for its environmental benefit.

items.title: Machete ambush after teenagers lured to park in Melbourne's west
items.description: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

items.title: Canberra woman charged with attempted murder after stabbing
items.description: A 37-year-old woman has been charged with attempted murder after allegedly stabbing a man with a steak knife.

items.title: Melbourne tram enthusiasts fight to save India's last tram network
items.description: Melbourne's iconic trams thrive in a car-centred world, but Asia's oldest tramway is now facing extinction.

items.title: 'High volume' response after application for QVB windows to be made clear
items.description: Dozens of people express opposition against a proposal to remove some of Queen Victoria Building's iconic coloured glass windows, after a development application stated they were not "fit for purpose in the eyes of global retail brands".

items.title: Two men charged over alleged prison murder
items.description: Two men are set to face court over the alleged murder of another prisoner in a Queensland jail.

items.title: Workers rehired as new managers revive Dicky Bill salad farms
items.description: About 160 staff lost their jobs when Dicky Bill collapsed owing up to $10 million. Two separate businesses have stepped in to take over, but not all operations will reopen.

items.title: Rising teen star Jones falls short in debut Brisbane International bid
items.description: The 17-year-old was aggressive in the opening set, but a broken racquet string knocked her focus and allowed her opponent to gain complete control of the match.
